PSP chairman Tan Cheng Bock introduces the candidates for West Coast-Jurong West GRC and Pioneer SMC.

site_title: ESR-Reit Q1 NPI up 31.3% at S$82.5 million on acquisitions, asset enhancements
summary: ESR-Reit reported a 31.3% increase in Q1 net property income (NPI) to S$82.5 million, driven by acquisitions of ESR Yatomi Kisosaki Distribution Centre in Japan and 20 Tuas South Avenue 14 in Singapore. Distributable income rose 7% to S$44.2 million. The increase was attributed to contributions from the two acquired properties, as well as asset enhancements and higher NPI of existing properties.

images.alt_text: Therese Soh
The results represent the first quarter of financial results after the real estate investment trust conducted its capital recycling strategy in 2023.

site_title: Huawei readies new AI chip for mass shipment as China seeks Nvidia alternatives: sources
summary: Huawei is set to begin mass shipments of its 910C AI chip to Chinese customers as early as next month, following a shift in US export policies that restrict Nvidia's sales of its H20 chip in China. The 910C, a graphics processing unit, offers performance comparable to Nvidia's H100 chip, with double the computing power and memory capacity. This move allows Huawei and Chinese GPU startups to compete with Nvidia in the Chinese AI market, which has been dominated by the US company.

images.alt_text: China remained a very important market for Nvidia, which will optimise its chip products to comply with US export controls, Jensen Huang says.
Tightening US export curbs have in recent years made it harder for American chipmakers to tap the Chinese market, but the country remains a key source of revenue.
The latest rules for Nvidia are a sign that the Trump administration will stay the course on the US government’s approach to Chinese tech development.
Manufacturing AI chips and supercomputers in the US will create hundreds of thousands of jobs in the coming decades, Nvidia said.
U Mobile chairman Vincent Tan said Huawei and ZTE were chosen as they had “a proven global deployment track record”.
“The alleged bribery is said to have benefitted Huawei,” the Belgian federal prosecutor’s office said.

site_title: GE2025: Tan See Leng anchors Chua Chu Kang GRC in surprise move; PM Wong faces SDP in Marsiling-Yew Tee GRC
summary: Minister for Manpower Tan See Leng will lead the People's Action Party (PAP) team in Chua Chu Kang GRC, replacing Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong who has shifted to Punggol GRC. Prime Minister Lawrence Wong and his team will face the Singapore Democratic Party (SDP) in Marsiling-Yew Tee GRC, a contest widely expected. The surprise changes come ahead of the 2025 General Election, with the PAP and SDP vying for power in nine constituencies.

images.alt_text: Jessie Lim

SDP secretary-general Chee Soon Juan (centre) with candidates (from left) Alec Tok, Jufri Salim, Gigene Wong and Ariffin Iskandar Sha Ali Akbar at a press conference which followed the walkabout on Sunday.

site_title: US dollar benefits from selling exhaustion, ECB cuts rates
summary: The US dollar has stabilized this week, holding within a tight range against the euro after recent weakness. The European Central Bank (ECB) cut interest rates for the seventh time in a year, aiming to prop up the struggling eurozone economy. The ECB's dovish tone and focus on downside risk to growth outlook suggest a pause in the dollar's recent strength. US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell stated that the Fed would wait for more data before changing interest rates, amid concerns over Trump's tariff policies.

images.alt_text: The ECB has been lowering borrowing costs as post-pandemic price pressures retreat, and recent trade-related turmoil on global markets is adding to the case for further policy easing.

site_title: CDL answers shareholders’ concerns on NAV-share price gap, board cohesion, Sherman Kwek’s strategy
summary: City Developments Ltd (CDL) has addressed shareholders' concerns about its share price decline, citing macroeconomic challenges and its removal from the MSCI Singapore Index. CDL's estimated revalued net asset value (RNAV) is S$19.86 per share, but its stock closed at S$4.47. The company attributes the share price gap to its role as a "barometer of Singapore's residential market" and its focus on transforming its portfolio through geographical diversification and expansion into new asset classes. CDL has also highlighted several divestments in its pipeline and share repurchase initiatives.

images.alt_text: Elysia Tan
What can CDL do to restore the confidence of investors?
Can Kwek Leng Beng be able to work harmoniously with Sherman Kwek on the uphill battle to regain investor confidence at CDL?
CDL executive chairman Kwek Leng Beng and his son and group CEO Sherman Kwek.
For FY2024, fixed salary accounted for 33.3 per cent, while short-term incentives accounted for 59.6 per cent of total compensation for group chief executive Sherman Kwek.

site_title: Global shipping navigates Trump tariffs uncertainty
summary: US President Donald Trump has announced a 90-day pause on some previously imposed tariffs, but the uncertainty has continued to impact the global shipping industry. New US port fees for Chinese-built and -operated ships are set to kick in from mid-October, adding to the volatility. Cargo ships are now sailing with reduced capacity, freight rates are fluctuating, and shipping routes are being adjusted, with some companies considering alternative routes such as Latin America. Industry experts expect a decline in China-US trade and a shift towards other destinations, with the World Trade Organization warning of a potential 1.5% decline in global goods trade in 2025.

images.alt_text: Cosco Shipping Corporation’s response marked the first reaction by the Asian nation’s maritime sector, after the US put forward a plan last week to impose fees on Chinese-built and -owned ships.
The Trump administration plans to impose fines of at least US$1 million on Chinese-made vessels from around the world that use US ports.
The spat over ocean shipping is the latest conflict in an intensifying trade war between China and the US that has pushed levies on each other’s imports beyond 100 per cent.

site_title: Market Focus Daily: Thursday, April 24, 2025
summary: Asian markets experienced mixed results, with Malaysia's stock market facing a bleak outlook due to foreign outflows, which negatively impacted sentiment. Meanwhile, India's tech companies are uncertain about the outcome of the ongoing trade war.

images.alt_text: Market updates for Thursday.
Tokyo rose more than 1 per cent, while Sydney added 0.6 per cent and Shanghai 0.3 per cent.
The negative sentiment triggered 26 consecutive weeks of foreign outflows since last November, pulling the FBM KLCI down 7.3 per cent to 1,513.65 in the first quarter of 2025.

site_title: AI’s hidden risk that no one is talking about
summary: A growing risk in AI development lies in the software supply chain, where open-source frameworks and libraries are vulnerable to cyber threats. Research found that nearly a third of AI workloads rely on Scikit-learn and Ollama, which can introduce security debt due to outdated code, unpatched vulnerabilities, and malicious insertions. As AI adoption increases, especially in the cloud, the risk of data leakage, model manipulation, and attack intensifies, requiring organizations to prioritize security and visibility in their AI systems.

images.alt_text: The latest rules for Nvidia are a sign that the Trump administration will stay the course on the US government’s approach to Chinese tech development.

site_title: GE2025: PSP says it has been hard at work despite the redrawn boundaries, is ready to engage voters
summary: The Progress Singapore Party (PSP) has confirmed it is preparing for the 2025 General Election, despite the short time to engage new residents due to redrawn boundaries. Party chief Leong Mun Wai stated that PSP has been working hard to prepare, citing their track record in Parliament, and is ready to engage voters with their "Progress For All" vision. The party has yet to confirm its line-up of candidates and deployment, with leaders and potential candidates seen entering the party headquarters. Nomination Day is set for April 23, and the election will be fought against a backdrop of global economic instability.

images.alt_text: The PAP introduced its team for West Coast-Jurong West GRC on Apr 15. From left to right: incumbent Members of Parliament Foo Mee Har, who is stepping down and Shawn Huang; new candidate Hamid Razak; anchor minister Desmond Lee; new candidate Cassandra Lee; Pioneer SMC MP Patrick Tay; and incumbent MP Ang Wei Neng.
Bukit Panjang SMC MP Liang Eng Hwa (second from right) and Holland-Bukit Timah GRC MPs (from left) Mr Edward Chia, Ms Sim Ann, Dr Vivian Balakrishnan and Mr Christopher de Souza on Apr 15.
(From left) Claressa Monteiro, Prof Walid Jumblatt Bin Abdullah and Dr Gillian Koh break down the unique traits of Singapore’s electoral system.
Yusof Ishak Secondary School will be where the candidates for three hot GRCs – East Coast, Sengkang and Punggol – will gather.
WP chief Pritam Singh (fourth from right) with the party's other elected MPs (from left) Dennis Tan, He Ting Ru, Faisal Manap, Gerald Giam, Jamus Lim, Sylvia Lim and Louis Chua.
Senior Minister Lee Hsien Loong delivering his opening remarks at a NTUC dialogue session with labour movement leaders and union leaders at the NTUC Centre on Apr 14.

site_title: China issues plan for expanding service sector opening-up
summary: China has issued a plan to expand its service sector opening-up, aiming to boost services consumption and support the economy amid rising trade tensions with the US. The plan includes lifting foreign equity ratio restrictions for app store services, promoting AI technology, and opening up the medical and healthcare sectors to foreign investors. It also allows financial institutions to expand their business and promotes the trading of yuan treasury bond futures. The move is expected to attract more foreign investment into China's services sector.

site_title: Luxury brand Hermes to pass on tariff costs to US clients as sales growth slows
summary: Hermes, a French luxury brand, plans to offset US tariffs by increasing prices for its US clients starting May 1. Despite a 7% sales rise in Europe, the company's first-quarter sales fell short of market expectations due to a slowdown in China. Hermes will maintain a tight grip on production, with 6-7% annual increases, to preserve its exclusive aura and resilience in a downturn. The company has not seen significant changes in US shopper behavior, and its market value has surpassed that of former suitor LVMH.

images.alt_text: Hermes has weathered the downturn in demand for luxury goods better than rivals by catering to the wealthiest and by cultivating a finely calibrated sense of exclusivity and managed scarcity.
The Hermes fortune derives from its namesake firm Hermes International, known for selling pricey Birkin handbags.

site_title: China to tighten EV battery rules to reduce fire and explosion risks
summary: China is tightening regulations on electric vehicle (EV) batteries to reduce fire and explosion risks. The new standards, set to be implemented from July 2026, require companies to ensure batteries won't catch fire or explode in tests with a specified time period. The rules update existing standards, which mandate a five-minute warning for potential fires, and add new tests for crash impacts and fast charging. The move aims to reduce risks for drivers, passengers, and surrounding properties, following a fatal crash involving a Xiaomi sedan in March.

images.alt_text: Down for a fifth straight session, Xiaomi's share price is now more than 20 per cent below a record high last month.
The driver assistance systems offered by Xiaomi and peers such as Xpeng and Huawei-backed EVs in China are similar to the technology that Tesla markets as Full Self-Driving.
CATL’s scale means it’s often able to spread costs out and deliver greater efficiencies.
BYD reveals game-changing 5-minute EV charging system.
Sunwoda Electronic is considering raising new funds for its electric-vehicle battery unit at a valuation of more than 20 billion yuan (US$3.1 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.

site_title: Ritz-Carlton lights up the Bangkok skyline
summary: The Ritz-Carlton Bangkok, located in the One Bangkok complex, boasts a luxurious and modern design that seamlessly blends Thai heritage with contemporary elegance. The hotel's outdoor terrace, dubbed a "sky garden," offers breathtaking views of Lumphini Park, while the flagship restaurant Duet serves quintessentially French cuisine with a focus on locally sourced herbs and Thai spices. The hotel's opulent interiors, installations by local artists, and exceptional service make it a standout in Bangkok's hotel scene, making its grand opening a well-worth wait for the Ritz-Carlton brand.

images.alt_text: Satoyama Jujo is enveloped in snow during winter.
Furano is known for its powdery snow, which is among the lightest and driest in Japan.
At the palatial Oberoi Amarvilas, every room comes with a private panorama of the Taj Mahal.

site_title: US housing starts decline by most in a year on single-family homes
summary: US housing starts decreased 11.4% in March to an annualized rate of 1.32 million, the largest decline in a year, mainly due to single-family homes. The decline was restrained by multifamily construction. High mortgage rates and prices continue to hamper the housing market, with builders facing higher costs due to President Trump's tariffs. Building permits for single-family homes fell to the slowest pace in four months, while multifamily authorizations climbed. The housing market is expected to remain constrained, with construction activity slowing throughout the year.

images.alt_text: The National Association of Home Builders/Wells Fargo Housing Market Index dropped three points to 39 this month, the lowest level since August
Donald Trump’s tariff wars with Mexico, Canada and China have the potential to drive interest rates higher by reheating inflation – or push them lower if the economy instead is tipped into recession.
Trump is banking that his strategy will lower barriers to US products and shift global manufacturing to the United States.
A gauge of overall conditions from the National Association of Home Builders (NAHB) and Wells Fargo rose one point to 40 in April, hovering near some of the lowest levels since late 2023.

site_title: Authentic and sparkly: The natural world according to Boucheron
summary: Boucheron's new high jewellery collection, Untamed Nature, showcases the brand's technical prowess and artistic finesse in representing the natural world in fluid and realistic forms. The 28-piece collection features plants and insects in white gold and diamonds, with intricate details and movement. Creative director Claire Choisne has expanded the maison's focus on detail, incorporating versatility and hidden mechanisms. Inspired by founder Frederic Boucheron's library of 600 works on nature, the collection reinterprets ordinary and humble subjects, such as beetles and dragonflies, in precious creations.

images.alt_text: Sean Lim rose from being a lowly-paid cook to a successful investor, car lover and property owner.
John Lim spent 10 years in the civil service before starting his entrepreneurial journey.
Born and bred in Germany, it was never Einhaus' plan to move to Nepal and help run his grandfather's heritage hotel.

site_title: GE2025: Grace Fu to lead PAP team to contest new Jurong East-Bukit Batok GRC
summary: Sustainability Minister Grace Fu will lead the People's Action Party (PAP) team in the newly created Jurong East-Bukit Batok Group Representation Constituency (GRC). The five-member team includes former Hougang candidate Lee Hong Chuang, former teacher David Hoe, and Ministers of State Murali Pillai and Rahayu Mahzam. Fu acknowledged the challenge of replacing the previous GRC's standout performer, President Tharman Shanmugaratnam, and emphasized the team's diversity and youth energy. The PAP will face opposition from Red Dot United, which is likely to field a team led by Liyana Dhamirah, who previously contested in Jurong GRC in 2020.

site_title: AmCham Singapore sets up trade task force on reciprocal tariffs, urges dialogue
summary: AmCham Singapore establishes a trade task force to gather member feedback on US tariffs, with chairman Elisa Mallis urging dialogue between the US and Singapore governments to ensure trade policies support economic prosperity and supply chain security. The chamber's survey found 83% of members believe tariffs are harmful to the business environment, with 69% reporting negative impacts on their companies. With nearly 6,000 US companies operating in Singapore, the task force aims to share findings with stakeholders and work with the government to maintain a stable business environment.

images.alt_text: Goh Ruoxue
Most economists expect a “slight” slope reduction of 50 basis points, including Citi, HSBC, Maybank, Standard Chartered and UOB. PHOTO: BT FILE
Unlike during Trump's first presidency, South-east Asia is now directly in the firing line for aggressive and high levies, says an analyst.

In a special Asean Economic Ministers' meeting chaired by Malaysia’s Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Tengku Zafrul Aziz (middle) has reached an unified voice to ruled out retaliation and pressing for “frank and constructive dialogue” with the United States to address trade-related concerns.
Since returning to the White House in January, US President Donald Trump has repeatedly threatened an array of punitive measures on trading partners, only to revoke some of them at the last minute.
US President Donald Trump has praised trading partners for coming forward to make concessions, but also brushed aside some offers.

Malaysia will host a special Asean Economic Ministers meeting on Thursday (Apr 10), seek to align the positions of member states to present a unified response during negotiations with the US as a single bloc.
US President Donald Trump’s latest tariff torpedo means South-east Asian countries have their work cut out for them as they face one of their biggest tests in recent times.

site_title: Taiwan’s Vanguard to hasten construction of Singapore factory
summary: Taiwan's Vanguard International Semiconductor Corp plans to speed up construction of its 12-inch wafer fab in Singapore due to geopolitical risks and customer demand for alternative chip manufacturing outside China. The factory, a joint venture with NXP Semiconductors, is on schedule and expected to begin mass production in 2027. Vanguard specializes in legacy chips used in products from cars to display panels, and some customers have placed urgent orders due to US tariffs. The company exports less than 1% of its chips directly to the US.

site_title: Gold falls as risk appetite dwindles on Trump’s tariff clarity
summary: Gold prices fell 0.5% to $3,097.99 an ounce, amid dwindling risk appetite following US President Donald Trump's tariff measures, which provided more clarity but raised concerns over an economic slowdown. Despite this, gold remains on track for a fifth consecutive weekly gain, driven by its safe-haven appeal. Market analysts attribute the decline to the reduced uncertainty surrounding Trump's trade policies, which had previously sparked a broader market sell-off.

images.alt_text: Gold, traditionally seen as a hedge against political and financial uncertainty, has surged over 19 per cent so far this year.

site_title: Nvidia to produce AI servers worth up to US$500 billion in US over four years
summary: Nvidia plans to produce AI servers worth up to $500 billion in the US over four years, aligning with the Trump administration's push for local manufacturing. The move is expected to create hundreds of thousands of jobs in the US. The company will partner with TSMC, Foxconn, and Wistron to produce AI chips and supercomputers in the US, with production starting in 12-15 months. The decision is seen as a response to threats of steep tariffs from President Trump, which could inflict significant pain on the booming AI industry.

images.alt_text: Chinese national Li Ming was offered bail of $1 million, while Singaporeans Alan Wei Zhaolun and Aaron Woon Guo Jie were offered bail of $800,000 and $600,000, respectively.
There is little sign the pain will end anytime soon, as seen by Friday’s 2.7 per cent tumble in the Nasdaq 100 as China retaliated.
The H20 is the primary chip Nvidia is legally permitted to sell in China and was launched after the latest round of US export restrictions took effect in October 2023.

Trade Minister Zafrul Aziz said that the US government was demanding Malaysia closely track the movement of high-end Nvidia chips that enter the country over suspicions that many are ending up in China, according to the report.
Nvidia's position at the forefront of chips needed for AI, and the billions of dollars of spending that’s anticipated this year, could mean recent weakness is just a phase.
Huang has been working to allay investor concerns over demand for Nvidia’s expensive AI chips
DeepSeek’s focus on reasoning will increase the need for computation, helping drive demand for Nvidia chips, Jensen Huang says.
Industry watchers expect Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to spotlight Nvidia’s latest Blackwell line of graphics processing units, including new updates in the works.

site_title: China retaliation on US farm goods hits soybeans, bolstering Brazil
summary: China has retaliated against US tariffs with 34% duties on all US goods, including agricultural products, marking a shift towards alternative suppliers like Brazil, which is poised to benefit from the trade war. US soybean imports to China have plummeted, with prices dropping 3.4% and Brazilian soybeans expected to surge in demand. The European Union is also likely to impose tariffs on US soybeans, further exacerbating the impact on US agricultural exports.

images.alt_text: China produces around 90 per cent of the world’s rare earths, a group of 17 elements used across the defence, electric vehicle, energy and electronics industries.
Beijing also announced controls on exports of medium and heavy rare earths, including samarium, gadolinium, terbium, dysprosium, lutetium, scandium and yttrium, to the US, effective Apr 4.
Chinese imports will be hit with a 34 per cent tariff, according to Trump, on top of the 20 per cent levy that he previously imposed on that country.
U.S. and Chinese flags are seen in this illustration taken March 20, 2025. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration
Chinese consumption has shown signs of resilience on a government initiative to subsidise purchases of cars and home appliances.

site_title: UK unveils support for tariff-hit auto sector to go green
summary: The UK government has unveiled plans to support the auto sector, hit by US tariffs, to transition to electric vehicles. The measures include easing rules to achieve the 2030 target, allowing for flexibility in meeting the annual target until 2026, and exempting small manufacturers. Petrol and diesel car sales will be outlawed by 2030, with hybrids allowed until 2035. The government has also announced £2.3 billion to boost electric vehicle production. UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is prepared to directly intervene to support affected sectors.

images.alt_text: The UK has about 75,000 non-doms – spanning top City of London bankers to owners of global businesses – who contribute more than £8 billion (S$13.9 billion) in taxes a year, according to the latest official data.
New vehicles for sale at a Chevrolet GMC dealership in California.
Travellers from Europe will now need a digital Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) permit, which UK officials said they were rolling out to boost security and streamline entry processes.

site_title: China offers banks extra gold import quotas as investors flock
summary: China's central bank has allocated extra gold import quotas to commercial banks in response to strong demand from institutional and retail investors amid geopolitical uncertainty. The decision follows a pilot programme allowing insurance funds to invest in gold and unusually strong inflows to onshore bullion-backed ETFs. Gold prices have doubled since 2022, reaching a record of $3,245.75 an ounce, with analysts predicting prices could reach $4,000 by mid-2026. The move aims to meet increased appetite for the metal, which has been driven by trade tensions and uncertainty.

images.alt_text: Two hundred and fifty gram gold bars arranged at Gold Investments Ltd. bullion dealers in London, U.K., on Thursday, March 17, 2022. Gold rose for a second day as investors weigh the trajectory of the Federal Reserve’s rates tightening cycle against risks to growth from the war in Ukraine. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

site_title: BP chair Helge Lund to step down amid Elliott campaign
summary: BP chair Helge Lund plans to step down "likely during 2026" amid a campaign by activist hedge fund Elliott for more change at the company. Lund, who has backed BP's 2020 strategy to cut hydrocarbon output, is facing opposition from Elliott, which wants a more ambitious asset disposal programme. The process to pick Lund's successor has started, with a new candidate expected to join the board and work with Lund before taking over in 2026. Lund's departure comes after a shift in BP's focus from oil and gas to more climate-focused strategies.

images.alt_text: BP’s management team and board of directors have changed little since Looney’s era, potentially making it a target for Elliott.

site_title: US: Wall Street opens lower as Trump tariffs loom
summary: US stock indexes opened lower on April 1, 2025, amid concerns over the Trump administration's impending tariff announcements. The Dow Jones fell 154.65 points, or 0.37%, to 41,845.98, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite also declined. Investors are bracing for the potential impact of the tariffs on the market.

site_title: Uncovering Raffles Sentosa’s secret to unforgettable escapes
summary: Raffles Sentosa Singapore, the brand's first all-villa resort, has opened its doors, offering guests unmatched space and seclusion in 100,000 sqm of lush greenery. Cluster General Manager Cavaliere Giovanni Viterale emphasizes the importance of embracing innovation and authenticity in luxury hospitality, creating experiences that are transformative and memorable. The resort features 62 spacious private villas, each with its own pool and terrace, and a holistic wellness program that prioritizes space, wellness, and connection to nature. Raffles Sentosa is poised to redefine luxury hospitality, with a focus on sustainability and personalized experiences.

images.alt_text: The outdoor terrace is a literal sky garden with its manicured landscaping  and cosy patio chairs.

site_title: GE2025: WP’s likely replacement for Raeesah Khan outlines plans for improvements in Sengkang
summary: Potential Workers' Party (WP) candidate Abdul Muhaimin Abdul Malik has outlined plans to improve lift issues in Sengkang GRC, a constituency in Singapore. As a senior property manager at Aljunied-Hougang Town Council, Muhaimin has experience managing lifts and aims to identify and address the root causes of lift problems in the estate. He has been seen at community events and has interacted with residents, including at a townhall meeting, and has been advised by WP vice-chairman Faisal Manap. Muhaimin's public promise has raised speculation that he could be fielded as a candidate in the upcoming general election.

images.alt_text: SAF Chief of Staff - Joint Staff Goh Pei Ming has held various senior command appointments within the SAF.
Minister for Law K Shanmugam says fellow Nee Soon GRC MP Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim is "unlikely to be here" after the associate professor was spotted at Eunos Crescent Market and Food Centre.

site_title: Malaysia’s Employees Provident Fund seeks more diverse exposure
summary: Malaysia's Employees Provident Fund (EPF) is diversifying its portfolio to ensure a well-balanced and resilient investment strategy amid global uncertainty. The fund, one of the world's largest pension funds, remains committed to the US and China due to their critical role in global trade and markets. As of 2024, EPF had RM1.25 trillion in investments, with 50.3% of its income coming from global assets and 37% from its portfolio. The fund is seeking to expand its exposure to other regions to mitigate risks triggered by US President Donald Trump's tariffs and policy orders.

site_title: Milan Design Week: Singapore talents create human-centred, sustainable solutions to contemporary issues
summary: Singapore designers showcase human-centred, sustainable solutions at Milan Design Week. Future Impact 3: Design Nation features 14 local talents, including established names and up-and-coming designers, who reimagine design's role in shaping people's lives and the world around them. The event highlights design's integral role in nation-building and its potential to tackle contemporary issues such as sustainability and quality of life. Designers showcase innovative works, including a solar cooker, a fungus-based product, and a handwoven screen, which blend technology, craftsmanship, and sustainability. The event aims to promote Singapore as a global design hub and accelerate growth, perspectives, and connections for young designers.

images.alt_text: TC&Friends - Future Impact 3 - MDW - Design Singapore
Designer, artist and maker Genevieve Ang (left) with Clement Zheng from Interactive Materials Lab.
Seven local designers will participate in Future Impact 2, which seeks to harness the evolving and transformative power of design for a more sustainable future.

site_title: At Augusta National, the Green Jacket awaits golf’s next Masters champion
summary: The Masters Tournament, one of golf's most prestigious events, is underway at Augusta National Golf Club. The 89th edition of the tournament, which began on April 10, features a star-studded field of golfers, including Scottie Scheffler, Jordan Spieth, and Brooks Koepka, as they vie for the coveted Green Jacket. With its immaculate course conditions and rich history, the Masters is considered one of golf's crowning achievements, demanding excellence and a relentless pursuit of perfection. The winner will not only claim the Green Jacket but also join an elite group of golfers who have achieved the ultimate prize.

Lee U-Wen

site_title: Asia: Markets boosted by ‘Big Progress’ in Japan tariff talks
summary: Tokyo's stock market rose on Thursday as optimism over Japan-US trade talks boosted markets, with shares in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Sydney, Singapore, Seoul, and Wellington also gaining. The news comes despite Federal Reserve boss Jerome Powell warning that US President Donald Trump's tariffs could lead to inflation and unemployment. Trump posted on social media that there had been "Big Progress!" in the talks, with Japan's envoy Ryosei Akazawa saying the US wants to make a deal within 90 days. The developments have tempered market disquiet after a recent sell-off fueled by talk of a global recession.

images.alt_text: Hong Kong led losses, dropping 1.8 per cent, while Shanghai, Tokyo, Seoul, Taipei, Manila and Jakarta were also down. Sydney, Singapore and Wellington rose.

site_title: EU pauses countermeasures following Trump’s tariff reprieve
summary: US President Donald Trump paused most of his new tariffs, lowering the 25% duties on steel and aluminum to 10% for 90 days. The move brought relief to global markets and anxious leaders, but Trump intensified pressure on China by raising tariffs on Chinese imports to 125%. The European Union had planned to launch counter-tariffs on $31.1 billion of US imports, but will now pause its measures. Trump's reversal also did not affect duties on autos, steel, and aluminum already in place. The US-China trade war remains unresolved, with China threatening to respond in kind after imposing 84% tariffs on US imports.

images.alt_text: U.S. President Donald Trump speaks, as he signs executive orders and proclamations in the Oval Office at the White House in Washington, D.C., U.S., April 9, 2025. REUTERS/Nathan Howard
